name: Filipinas (MartholemyLabs)
description:
I'd love to hear your thoughts about it! If you have the time, you can send those comments over through this comments form: https://forms.gle/gPR6DoZW96tbx39V6 Video Trailer coming soon. Touchscreen Controls: Tap spaces or objects to move or select respectively, Tap twice to bring up and/or exit the Menu Screen. 

 Keyboard Controls: Use Directional Buttons to move around, "Z" confirms, and "X" Cancels.

It's a fairly simple idea: what if the entire Philippines was plotted out like the map of a computer adventure game? The following is a Proof-of-Concept, meant to be updated and expanded on in stages and very much meant to evolve with community support. In it's current stage, it allows a fair amount of Guided Exploration Learning for people interested in getting into Philippine Geography. Subdivided into 100km2 tiles, the National Map includes all 300,000 square kilometers of Philippine Territory with markers for the capitals of the 81 provinces, plus a handful of independent cities, popular resort destinations, and natural wonders. The following provinces, while still largely under development, also currently have explorable Provincial Pavilions - areas designed to celebrate a province's people, history, and culture concisely: + Cavite + Mountain Province

I hope you have fun! Researched, written, and designed by Marthy Angue.

Illustrated and Programmed by Marthy Angue on RPG Maker MV with heavily repurposed illustrated and coded elements from the RPGMaker MV community. Special thanks to Yanfly, Pandamaru, and Moghunter. "Quiapo Free" font is by Aaron Amar.
